meanings.sent1: It would misbecome a teacher to yell at their students.
meanings.sent2: Talking loudly in a library would misbecome the quiet atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: It would misbecome a penguin to try to fly like a bird.
meanings.sent4: Wearing a swimsuit to a formal event would misbecome the occasion.
meanings.sent5: His rude behavior misbecame his usual polite demeanor.

meanings.definition: To not be fitting or appropriate
meanings.sent1: It would misbecome a cat to bark like a dog.
meanings.sent2: Wearing pajamas to a job interview would misbecome the professional setting.
meanings.sent3: Eating ice cream for breakfast might misbecome a healthy diet.
meanings.sent4: Her bright red shoes misbecame the somber tone of the funeral.
meanings.sent5: His casual attitude misbecame the seriousness of the situation.
